required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Microbial Soy Milk Consumption, Inflammation and Renal Function Among Type 2 Diabetic Patients With Nephropathy

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the present study was to determine the effects of fortified soy milk with L. planetarium A7 on a cytokine receptor, an adipokine and renal function biomarkers in type II diabetic patients with nephropathy.

primary_outcome.description: PGRN will determine by commercial sandwich enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) kits according to the manufacturer's protocols. (Human ELISA kits, Shanghai Crystal Day Biotech Company, China).

primary_outcome.measure: cytokine receptor -soluble tumor necrosis factor receptor 1 (sTNFR1),
primary_outcome.description: sTNFR1 will determine by commercial sandwich enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) kits according to the manufacturer's protocols. (Human ELISA kits, Shanghai Crystal Day Biotech Company, China).

primary_outcome.measure: serum levels of Neutrophil gelatinase-associated lipocalin (NGAL)
primary_outcome.description: NGAL will determine by commercial sandwich enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) kits according to the manufacturer's protocols. (Human ELISA kits, Shanghai Crystal Day Biotech Company, China).
Cys- C will determine by commercial sandwich enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) kits according to the manufacturer's protocols. (Human ELISA kits, Shanghai Crystal Day Biotech Company, China).

clinical_study.condition: Type II Diabetic Patients With Nephropathy

arm_group.description: consume a diet containing 200 ml/day probiotic soy milk in intervention group
200 ml/day soy milk in the control condition

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults
- Type 2 diabetic patients with stages 1 and 2 of nephropathy (defined as meeting criteria including fasting blood glucose >126 mg/dL, hypoglycemic agents, or insulin intake, proteinuria >300 mg/day, and glomerular filtration rate >90 mL/min)
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnancy or lactating in women
- allergy or intolerance to soy milk or avoidance of soy milk consumption
- smoking, alcoholism
- recent antibiotic therapy and using of supplements containing vitamins and minerals
- any medical condition such as inflammatory bowel disease, infection, liver disease and rheumatoid arthritis.

responsible_party.investigator_title: MSc student, Principal Investigator, Department of Community Nutrition, School of Nutrition and Food Science, Isfahan University of Medical Sciences, Isfahan, Iran
